@jiazhai According to what we discussed, we need an ordered LongPairSet to support ordered guarantees of message re-delivery in key_shared subscription, added a task to track this feature #4077 , i will work with a new PR.

run Integration Tests

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests
@tuteng if you have free time please write some integration tests for localrun
@tuteng i am actually in the process of writing some tests for local run
Fixed. Jersey is now removed from shaded.
According to @sijie it might be related to https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/4118.

> @tuteng if you have free time please write some integration tests for localrun

I tried to add a test using the example you provided https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/4248, but I didn't find how to verify it in the localrun mode, because it can be verified by getstatus in other modes.

> @tuteng i am actually in the process of writing some tests for local run

Can you give a general idea, I can continue to improve it.
@merlimat I'm already address your comment. PTAL.
@tuteng please take a look as well
I see that it now failed with "activation-1.1.1.jar mentioned in LICENSE, but not bundled" I will remove this from LICENSE file and push.
@sijie could you please help merge? Thanks.
@rdhabalia  There are some PRs on going for [PIP-36](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/wiki/PIP-36%3A-Max-Message-Size), will it partly solve this issue?
over all lgtm. @Jennifer88huang @Anonymitaet would you please also take a look, if you have time?
If the concern is around efficiency, internally, messages are transported in batches. With that, there’s not a real difference between getting a list of messages or getting them one by one

Yep, I agree the efficiency is not much different. But what I need to do is to get a batch list of messages and do a batch thing with them, such as batch insert, etc. In the current consumer API, I have to buffer the messages into memory myself, which is not convenient.
@tuteng @merlimat I switched the tests to run via real integration test framework since its more suited for that
@wolfstudy Thank you very much for discovering this problem in time. Please review the changes.

Let me verify it a little bit more;
Before I do that, let me close this pull request.

Not sure if it's related, but I get similar error message when running a single bookie using the K8S examples from `deployment/kubernetes/generic` in minikube. After restarting minikube, I also get the following error: 

```
16:16:49.822 [main] ERROR org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.Bookie - There are directories without a cookie, and this is neither a new environment, nor is storage expansion enabled. Empty directories are [data/bookkeeper/journal/current, data/bookkeeper/ledgers/current]
16:16:49.822 [main] INFO  org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookieNettyServer - Shutting down BookieNettyServer
16:16:49.834 [main] ERROR org.apache.bookkeeper.server.Main - Failed to build bookie server
org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.BookieException$InvalidCookieException: 
	at org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.Bookie.checkEnvironmentWithStorageExpansion(Bookie.java:470) ~[org.apache.bookkeeper-bookkeeper-server-4.9.0.jar:4.9.0]
	at org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.Bookie.checkEnvironment(Bookie.java:252) ~[org.apache.bookkeeper-bookkeeper-server-4.9.0.jar:4.9.0]

	at org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookieServer.newBookie(BookieServer.java:137) ~[org.apache.bookkeeper-bookkeeper-server-4.9.0.jar:4.9.0]
```

What do I have to change to make it work with minikube?

@tuteng we can probably close this PR
I noticed this problem doesn't exist if you point to something like "pulsar://unreachable:9999" if that helps narrow the scope.
@jiazhai cpp tests keeps failing without notice of any failed tests, any hint on this? keep trying?

@sleungtoast Nice catch! The leak is there because the `ClientCnx` object is created but since the connection fails to get established, it will never call the `connectionInactive()` handler. 

The leaked memory though is smaller than the above reported (eg: I did put a `System.gc()` in between because `Runtime.freeMemory()` is not accounting for non-referenced objects).
Please don't merge this yet. I haven't fully incorporated the review comments from @Jennifer88huang and @Anonymitaet
@merlimat can you please review this PR, we want to use it for 2.4 release.
